statement:
Let $X$ be any set, $\{f_n\}_{n\in{\mathbb{N}}}$ a sequence of real or
complex valued functions on $X$ and $\{M_n\}_{n\in{\mathbb{N}}}$ a
sequence of non-negative real numbers. Suppose that, for each
$n \in {\mathbb{N}}$ and $x \in X$, we have $|f_n(x)| \le M_n$. Then
$f=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_n$ converges uniformly if
$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_n$ converges.
